EN: We remember the Elder.
I used to help others. They were brought to me sick and dying... What difference did it make?...<page>Any victory against death will always be temporary.

My mind... it clears. Have we been... sleeping, child?<page>Aah... I remember. Those proud lords... were they truly monsters? I remember their eyes now... bright and clear. Why then did I fear them so?<page>If there was madness in that village, it was I who brought it. They were right to cast me out.<page>When I attacked, they were right to...<page>They were right to kill...<page>To kill... me...?<page>...aah.
Don't fear my rotting form. Though my body sheds and changes my core remains the same.
Seeking power is a hollow goal. Best to search for other things.
Go bother someone else. You're not the one I'm waiting for.
Do you still hope, wanderer? Will you flee? Or will you raise your weapon and doom us both?
We're always left with reminders of the errors we've made. Let your mistakes not burden you, but serve as guideposts on where not to travel.
So then... shall we do battle? Let us test our strength in joyful combat!
Are you admiring my fabulous markings? I'm of a distinguished species you see, though I've not seen another like me for the longest time.

Ahhh, a wanderer.<page>I've been many places and done a great many things, but I suspect you will outdo me by far.<page>I've long ceased travelling the caverns of Hallownest and I suspect they're now far more dangerous than in my journeys, though with your capable air I'm sure you'll do fine.<page>Good luck! It's a vast world out there.
Hark, fellow adventurer! Are you heading out into the world? I'd join you, but it's been so long, I fear I'd lose my head.
Here lies Gorb, the Great Mind.

Oh! The Queen! The Queen is coming! I've been waiting so long, and now she's almost here! I feel like I'm about to burst!<page>I've kept it safe, this sacred garden! I've kept it safe for all this time, and soon the Queen will return and teach me to fly!<page>Shall we wait together, stranger? Shall we play together?
Are you enjoying your time in our glade? I'd offer advice, though to have made it here you're obviously quite adept at navigating our world and its perils.
Stand strong little warrior.

Isn't this just the most intriguing place? So many discoveries waiting to be made. We're about to set off ourselves, though we can't seem to agree on which way to head.<page>It's led to something of an argument between us. We should really stop squabbling about such petty things.
Do you like my nails little wanderer? I carry only three, far less than legends may suggest.<page>Still! Each is sharper than the last and I'd require only one to cut you down.
Buy my cookies! Once I've sold them all I can go home.
All of life's problems can be solved with crushing force. Such a simple mantra and one I've always lived by.<page>If you weren't so scrawny, I'd suggest you follow my example.
My appearance should not cause you worry. Here I am truly at peace.

Unbelievable... I am defeated at last! So this is what it feels like to be bested...<page>Still though, I am strong, am I not? When you see our King, surely you'll tell him of my valour...?<page>Yes... he sent you here to test me, didn't he? I knew he had not forgotten brave Galien.<page>I am ready... to join you now. Brothers, you and I. Let us leave this place...<page>...together...
The body of a fallen warrior.
Precious children, a monster has come for us in the dark...Will you sing for me?
Beware dreams of glory, child. Turn back, and do not return.
You're very impressive for such a small thing. I'm something of a warrior myself, though even I'd hesitate to raise my nail against you.
Do as you will little wanderer. Cut a path toward your goal.<page>I shouldn't complain. It's your kind that keeps folks like me in business.

You have come a long way, just to die here at the edge of the world.<page>No, do not speak. I have heard thousands and thousands of empty words from those like you. Your pride, your desires, your desperation... you will take these things with you once I strike you down.<page>Raise your weapon then, and die like those who came before you.
Even if only you, it's a wonderful thing to have an audience again.
A face carved from stone.

Small thing. I know your kind.<page>If you attempt to resolve your past then know I am not the queen you seek.<page>It is the pale beings that bear blame for your nature.<page>Though this hive exists within Hallownest, we play no part in its attempt at perpetuation.

Ah... I can see now. Those who turn against the King are doomed as soon as they raise their weapon.<page>Do not call me a traitor. Simply call me a fool.<page>I know you will not flee. Wherever you go... I will be watching.

Oh, stranger... you're strong. Much stronger than me...<page>I've been waiting a long time, stranger. I've been fighting a long time, stranger.<page>I'm very, very tired! The Queen will be here soon, and I just need to sleep a little.<page>Wake me when the Queen arrives, stranger. Perhaps the Queen will teach us both to fly, stranger!<page>That... would be fun... wouldn't it...?
I came from far away to reach this place. Though my shell may seem foreign, beneath it I am a bug the same as you.
Remember tiny bug, crush your fears; crush your problems; crush your foes.
The bugs within this glade are under my watch. Treat them with respect and you may remain, but raise your nail and you'll contend with me.
Don't fear little creature. Though a violent rage once possessed me the peaceful air in this place seems to keep it at bay.
Shall we wait together, stranger? Shall we play together?

Stop there! Those who try to leave this kingdom are cursed. Better to rest here, until time itself sleeps.<page>Hope and freedom. I thought that strength alone could grant me these things. In my dreams I would cut that plague with my nails, and then I turned my weapons upon the King.<page>When I awoke in this sacred place, I began to understand. Those who hope are already doomed.<page>Do you still hope, wanderer? Will you flee? Or will you raise your weapon and doom us both?
Watch out!<page>I've an acidic touch and I wouldn't want you getting burned. It's a protection system of my kind, though something of a nuisance when it comes to meeting others.
My Knight... At last you are freed.

In my dreams I could see it. The Kingdom's salvation, the cure for the plague... the answer was in the soul that animates our bodies.<page>But the King... why?! He opposed everything I did...<page>His jealousy... his madness... by standing against me he robbed me of my immortality!<page>Now the King and his Kingdom are dead... but I... will live forever.
The body of a warrior, with a shield and nails.
To rail against nature is folly. All things must accept an end.
To protect? Was that my task? If so, who was I protecting? It's only you and me here.

Welcome to my stage little one. I am Marissa, a songstress of some renown, though given the sorry state of this place, you may find it hard to believe. <page>Huge crowds once flocked to hear me sing, then something changed. The audience, once so enrapt, began to leave. I continued to sing yet my voice fell silent upon their ears.<page>Perhaps you'd care to listen to me sing? You'll be the first in an age to hear it.
Left or right? Which way is best? It should be a simple thing, yet we're always at odds.
Cursed are those who turn against the King.
You wouldn't have the guts to face me anyway.
These husks around my neck? They're my precious friends, always there to keep me company and much better for conversation than the rest of the odd lot around here.
Though my body sheds and changes my core remains the same.
Any victory against death will always be temporary.... What a gloomy thought.
Raise your weapon then, fool, and die like those who came before you.

My child... can you still see? Please, don't hurt me.<page>Can't sleep... with your eyes open, little one. Can't dream... if you're still breathing, little one.<page>Precious children... you speak such loathsome things as you sleep... your claws scratch and scrape...<page>Precious children, a monster has come for us in the dark...Will you sing for me?
Ahhh, I see you bear my blessing. I can't remember giving it, but my memory has been a little lacking of late.
I... am Gorb!<page>The great mind... the pain! Ascend! Ascend!<page>I... I am...

Ehh... Another wielding a weapon. I suppose you'll be leaving many a corpse in your wake?<page> If you won't spare thought for the dead at least consider all the extra work you force upon those in my profession.
Buy my cookies! They're ever so tasty.

One by one... their eyes closed at last. I felt it... a warm stillness falling over us.<page>I'm sorry I was frightened of you. You were always protecting us, even when we couldn't see you.<page>Take us there, please. A place where light can not haunt us, a place without dreams...Please...
Aren't my nails the most wonderful things? Their gleaming blades so sharp and deadly.

You find it strange to see a moth wielding a weapon? We are a passive species, though I am not the only one amongst us to take up arms.<page>Another braved the edges of this world, hoping to uncover a truth long forgotten.<page>I wonder what became of him?
Protector of root and leaf, we honour you.
You don't seem to bear the markings of rank, though you bear no markings of a lower form.<page>What are you? Do tell me. Are you a higher being or just another lowly grub?
Beware your own mind little one. Twisted minds breed dark deeds and mine was more twisted than most.<page>I thought it would be my end, but instead I found this glade and with it a sort of peace.
I'm envious of you, facing this world without fear. I could stand to learn from your approach.

Hoh, a fellow warrior, out here? I thought I was the only one brave enough and strong enough to survive in this foul, forgotten pit.<page>I am Galien, the strongest warrior in Hallownest! I came to this monstrous place to test my strength. No doubt you wish to test your might as well, hmm?<page>Yes, you and I are a rare breed, quite unlike this poor fellow who has fallen before us. The world is not kind to the weak, I fear.<page>So then... shall we do battle? Let us test our strength in joyful combat!
I've been waiting an awfully long while. Surely it's dinner time soon?

The glade has stilled. It's so quiet, yet I feel... failure? In this place, I once performed a task, but what was it?..  It's so hard to recall. Surely it was important? How could I forget such a thing?
Skroink! You look pretty skinny. Very scrawny. That's the way to be I reckon.<page>Just look at me! A great big, juicy, fatty, oily... scrumptious bug. No wonder I'm so popular around here.
I am Gorb!<page>Bow! Bow bow bow bow to Gorb!<page>The great mind! I am Gorb!<page>Ascend! Ascend! Ascend ascend ascend with Gorb!
I assure you wanderer, my nail is sharp and I'll not hold back.
Ascend! Ascend! Ascend ascend ascend with Gorb!
Isn't it just so peaceful here? Such a perfect place to rest.
"I'll see you soon," she said, though that was long ago. I wonder where she went?

Wait, child! Why have you come here? Have you come to tame this savage, ruined land?<page>Many have come to purify this place, but all who dwell here are eventually consumed.<page>Yes, even the wild bugs lurking below us. They were once proud like you, but now they are only monsters.<page>Beware dreams of glory, child. Turn back, and do not return.
Are you a warrior, little one? A true warrior is one who can stand strong in the midst of a storm.

Never... have I been defeated in combat.<page>I can... see myself there, still sleeping. How long have I been hidden here?<page>Here at the edge of the world, no-one could find me... except you.<page>Warriors, knights, kings, even time itself... they have no power over me. Only you.<page>You are the darkness... come to consume me.
I was once obsessed with power though my time within this glade has shed me of such desire.<page>What folly it was to ever crave such a vicious thing.

I wanted it.... the strength to protect the others...<page>When I saw that Knight... sleeping... safe in his big armoured shell...<page>It wasn't madness that drove me to it... I just wanted it...<page>But... in the end? If strength cannot save you, then what can...?
Don't judge me by appearance. Though my stature is small, I bear a dark soul and a tendency to go berserk in battle.
Don't get too close. I'd not wish to cause any harm.
Do you think dark thoughts little one? When hidden behind a visage as impassive as your own, I find it hard to tell.
You too are a warrior? I see your nail, but your shell seems underdeveloped. In your current state, to travel a land as dangerous as this seems unwise.
